title: Structuring Your Novel - K. M. Weiland
description:
Why do some stories work and others donâ€™t? 
The answer is structure. In this IPPY and NIEA-Award winning guide from the author of the bestselling Outlining Your Novel, you will learn the universal underpinnings that guarantee powerful plot and character arcs.

An understanding of proper story and scene structure will show you how to perfectly time your storyâ€™s major events and will provide you with an unerring standard against which to evaluate your novelâ€™s pacing and progression. 

Structuring Your Novel will show you:
How to determine the best techniques for empowering your unique and personal vision for your story.
How to identify common structural weaknesses and flip them around into stunning strengths.
How to eliminate saggy middles by discovering your â€œcenterpiece.â€
Why you should NEVER include conflict in every scene.
How to discover the questions you donâ€™t want readers asking about your plotâ€”and then how to get them to ask the right questions.
Story structure has enabled countless bestselling and classic authors. Now itâ€™s your turn!
